result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J McGilligan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle J McGilligan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle J McGilligan was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Kyle J McGilligan was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Kyle J McGilligan was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 1 day was granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance of Image Surcharges to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Must register as a Sex Offender on the Sex Offender Registry. Not to possess any sexually explicit material. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
*Sentencing Memorandum filed by Defense to accompany the Judgment of Conviction. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

2nd Amended Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment, as to Counts 2, 3 & 5, granted and signed by Judge Maria S. Lazar 06/25/2020.
Second Amended Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment now granted signed by Judge Maria S. Lazar 06/24/2020 - correcting the Counts.
Amended Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment now granted signed by Judge Maria S. Lazar 06/24/2020.

08:38 AM Defendant Kyle J McGilligan in court by telehphone, in custody at John Burke Correctional, with attorney Jerome F Buting who appeared by Zoom video.   Michael Thurston appeared by Zoom video for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court notes that there is an issue with video and that defense counsel nor the State can see the Court but the Court can see both counsel through Zoom.  Based on agreement of counsel court will continue with the hearing by audio means only.  Case called for hearing on Defendant's Motion to Reconsider Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  Court reviews the motion on the record.  Atty. Buting presents arguments.  Atty. Thurston presents arguments.  Atty. Buting presents additional arugments.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court grants Defendant's Motion to Reconsider Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  The Court will issue an order to modify the sentence accordingly today.
Review hearing on June 22, 2020 at 08:30 am.
State's reply to the Memorandum Requesting Response sent by the Court on April 29, 2020.  The State doesn't object to the Court reconsidering the petition for sentence adjustment.
From the Court to the District Attorney's office requesting a response.

To Reconsider Petition For Sentence Adjustment under 973.195 filed by Atty. Buting.

  ** Reviewed by Judge Lazar on 04/27/2020--Clerk to inquire if State will file a response brief; will be due in 21 days or less.**
Filed by attorney Jerome Buting

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 7/25/17 Sentencing

Defendant Kyle J McGilligan in court with Attorney Jerome F Buting.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Buting makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  (1 DAY CREDIT)    *CONCURRENT WITH COUNTS #3 & 5 *
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Not to possess any sexually explicit material 
____Must register as a sex offender on sex offender registry 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

NOTE:  Amended Sentencing memorandum submitted by the defense is to accompany the Judgmen of Conviction
 
COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($2,500) and remainder to be applied to Image Surcharge)

IMAGE SURCHARGE:  $500 X 5 images = $2,500.00 (to be paid out of balance of cash bail posted and remainder due as a condition of extended supervision)  


COUNT #3:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  (1 DAY CREDIT)    *CONCURRENT WITH COUNTS #2 & 5 *
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Not to possess any sexually explicit material 
____Must register as a sex offender on sex offender registry 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

NOTE:  Amended Sentencing memorandum submitted by the defense is to accompany the Judgmen of Conviction
 
COSTS:  $268.00  (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($2,500) and remainder to be applied to Image Surcharge)


COUNT #5:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  (1 DAY CREDIT)    *CONCURRENT WITH COUNTS #2 & 3 *
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Not to possess any sexually explicit material 
____Must register as a sex offender on sex offender registry 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

NOTE:  Amended Sentencing memorandum submitted by the defense is to accompany the Judgmen of Conviction
 
COSTS:  $268.00  (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($2,500) and remainder to be applied to Image Surcharge)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Kyle J McGilligan in court with attorney Jerome F Buting.  Debra L Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel presents arguments as to his motion for dismissal as to counts 1, 3 and 4. State objects and presents arguments. Court grants the motion to dismiss count 4. Court denied the motion as to counts 1 and 3. Detective Michael C. from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State.  Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects to bind over and renews his motion to dismiss as to count 3 and moves to dismiss count 6. Court denied and court does find probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.
